definition: lit. to unbutton/fig. to solve a dispute
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: The test is completed when unbuttoning commences without a fracture in the weld.
sentences.chinese: 当开始解扣而焊接处却没有裂缝的时候，测试完成了。

sentences.english: 3 years old is the child of ZuiJiaQi buckle button training solutions.
sentences.chinese: 3岁是对儿童进行解扣纽扣训练的最佳期等。

definition: variant of 紐扣|纽扣[niu3 kou4]
please take off your coat (honorific)/loose-fitting garment
hidden snap fastener (concealed behind a flap on a garment)
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
